newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss bond market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Swiss bond market closing report.

text.p: Swiss bond prices ended sharply lower with the market under pressure from declines in other markets, triggered by nervousness about the U.S..
Swiss markets fell after turbulence in U.S. markets on Monday when European markets were still closed for Easter.

Swiss bonds were down sharply on the day, with the June Confederate bond futures contract falling for much of the session. The Swiss close coincided with release of the U.S. National Association of Purchasing Management (NAPM) index. The NAPM rose to 55.0 in March from 53.1 in February. U.S. bonds were holding fairly steady in trade after the number.

Swiss bonds were closing as the NAPM was released. Swiss traders were waiting for Wednesday's opening here to assess the impact of the latest U.S. data on Swiss bonds. Swiss shares tumbled on Tuesday following Wall Street's weakness on Monday.
